climbs.name: Two Bits
climbs.fa: B. Spannuth, equipped by W. Anglin

content.description: Two Bits is resistant climbing to a bad rest then a crux, followed by a better rest, then two more cruxes. It is quite hard.
content.location: This climbs the prominent white face capped by a black bulge.

content.description: There are a lot of 5.12s at God's Crag, and this is definitely one of the best. It has long moves, interesting holds, good rests, and is steeper than the Creamy Salmon Wall.
content.location: This is the route farthest right on the Zebra Wall, just before the cave.

climbs.name: Pool Shark
climbs.fa: B. Spannuth, equipped by B. Spannuth

content.description:
Start with some 5.13- climbing through some dihedrals to a rest at the base of the first bulge climb a hard boulder through a mono pocket or dyno to a sharp jug. Some more consistent climbing leads to another rest and then another boulder problem and a big move to a slope-y finish hold.

The 5th bolt is a bit far to the left. It doesn't make too much of a difference when clipping, but it could lead you astray beta-wise.
content.location:
This is just right of

Fruit Stripe

.

climbs.name: Fruit Stripe
climbs.fa: B. Spannuth, equipped by B. Spannuth

content.description: This has consistent pocket climbing with less-than-great rests. There are multiple cruxy sections with a heartbreaker at the top. It has some of the coolest moves on the wall!
The first 1/3 of the route looks pretty chossy and is a bit of a squeeze job. The rock up top looks good though.
content.location:
It is just left of

Pump Action Hero

.
